<p>
This Shiny app displays an interactive datatable using one of two libraries: <a href=https://rstudio.github.io/DT>DT</a> and <a href=http://jrowen.github.io/rhandsontable/#introduction>rhandsontables</a> of the following Figshare <a href="https://figshare.com/articles/Investigation_into_the_number_of_desktop_items_on_University_staff_computers_broken_down_by_department_and_operating_system_/3425729">dataset</a>.</p>

<p>
Both the `DT` and `rhandsontable` library provide a wide range of functionality natively, without Shiny - see <a href=http://martinjhnhadley.github.io/OxfordIDN_htmlwidgets/datatable>http://martinjhnhadley.github.io/OxfordIDN_htmlwidgets/datatable</a> for more details. This template relies on Shiny for minimal interactivity, but note that significantly more interactivity is possible.</p>

- Switching between libraries
- Displaying the selected row in the dataset

<p>The code for this shiny app is available on <a href="https://github.com/martinjhnhadley/OxfordIDN_htmlwidgets/tree/gh-pages/datatable">GitHub</a></p>
